Rows of graves sprawl before them, graves carved with nam frighteningly familiar: Virginia Boone.. Harper Alexander Hester and Glendora.. Rufus, Lester (and Jez, of course). Anderson and Joey circle round in shock, trying to make sense of it all. Sheriff Freidman stares them down.

I ought to lock you both up for wastin' my precious time! This is your Pleasant Valley! Ain't nothing but a graveyard been here the last hundred fifty years. If I hada dollar for every drunken college kid come hollerin' about flesh eatin' ghouls, me and Elvis coulda retired in comfort years ago. Anderson and Joey back away from Freidman. This can't be happening.
No! There was a town here! People... We saw them!
Missy, I'm just gonna assume you've been smokin' that reefer and let it go at that!
No way, man! You're full of shit! Sheriff Freidman takes out his handcuffs. Anderson steps forward in defense.
All right! Stop! We're sorry! It was... a joke. A prank... The Sheriff puts away the cuffs. Smirks.
I'm sure the poor souls of these fine people who died at the hands of you Northern heathens ain't so partial to your joke! (CONTINUED)

Sheriff Freidman points a marble statue. None other than the chiseled likeness of Mayor George W. Buckman himself. Buckman looms tall and proud, standing guard over a tarnished plaque, circa 1862, imbedded in the earth below
What? Like a teacher proving his history lesson, Freidman shine his flashlight on the plaque's inscription.
It's called respect, son. Stunned, Anderson and Joey walk over to the plaque. Slowl he begins to read aloud.

"To the 2001 innocent confederate citizens of Pleasant Valley laid to waste on this very spot by renegade Yanks during The War Between the States, this plaque is hereby devoted as a pledge of blood justice. An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth, never will they rest in peace till one for one they are avenged..."

It's dated March 22nd. That's... today. The sound of SCREECHING TIRES jolts them to attention. Th turn to see the Sheriff's car pulling away, the DAWNING S now beginning to peek through the trees. Alone, Anderson and Joey survey the desolate landscape. 2001 graves.......
Could we really have just imagined it all? Could it possibly be some kind of joke? Anderson points to the gash in his forehead.
This is real. And it's no joke. That inbred Sheriff is probably one of them. We gotta do something. (CONTINUED)
Maybe if we ride further north... What if we went to the FBI?

Forget the FBI. I say we get the fucking Marines and invade the South all over again. The WIND blows through the cemetery, rustling the leaves an old oak tree. The effect is that of a ghostly whisper. Or is it laughter? Joey wraps her arms around Anderson.

You're on. She seals the pact with a kiss, continuing to hold on to Anderson for a moment of comfort. But the moment's soon over when Anderson pulls away and, with forceful venom, spits directly onto Buckman's marbled face. The final desecration...
Fuck you, Pleasant Valley. With that, Anderson takes Joey's hand and heads out.

location: DIRT ROAD OUT OF PLEASANT VALLEY

text: The motorcycle drives past the roadside sign ("Pleasant Valley. Population 2001") coursing away from the town.
Spittle drips down the stone face of Mayor Buckman, which now appears to be smiling a malevolent grin...

location: DIRT ROAD OUT OF PLEASANT VALLEY

text: Further up ahead... A FIGURE can be seen standing in the center of the road. Anderson slows the bike down and cautiously inches forwar Once closer, he and Joey can see that the figure is Hucklebilly, waving his arms and hootin' and hollerin'. (CONTINUED)
Oh no, not again...

Fuck that little shit. We'll drive around him. Anderson floors the engine and speeds right past Hucklebilly, knocking him flat on his ass. The boy behind them, he and Joey turn around to take one last glimpse at Pleasant Valley. They can't help but laug with relief. Now turning to face the course ahead, they detect a line rusty BARBED WIRE extended across the dirt road between t telephone poles. It's too late to stop... Or scream. The motorcycle glides under the sharpened cord, which cut through the necks of both Anderson and Joey. Their decapitated heads fly from their bodies, which continue t ride the two-wheeler before it comes to a crashing halt a EXPLODES . The liberated heads emerge from the FLAMES, bouncing alon the path like bloody basketballs. With great finesse, Hucklebilly runs and scoops them up. Cheshire grin crosses his face from ear to ear.
Damn Yankees! A severed head in each hand, the boy walks off into the southern sunrise, whistling Dixie...
